result.execSummary:
All charges against Lorenzo M Miner in this case have been dismissed. These charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Lorenzo M Miner is presumed innocent.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

judgments.dispoDesc: insufficient probable cause at preliminary hearing

chargeModifiers.descr: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: Pre-trial conference on October 31, 2022 at 10:00 am.

(Arraignment held for 22CF300-ss)
Defendant received copy of information.
Defendant waives reading of information. 

NOT GUILTY plea(s) entered.

BY THE COURT:  Bond continued.

3:53 PM
Defendant Lorenzo M Miner in court. Attorney Gary J. Kryshak in court for Lorenzo M Miner. Attorney Jedidiah J Dodge in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Court calls cases 22CF351 and 22CF300.
ADA Dodge states appearances.
Matter set for preliminary hearing. 

IN 22CF351: (correction case 22CF300-ss)
Detective Aaron Yenter is sworn in by the clerk.
Direct exam by ADA Dodge.
Atty Kryshak stipulates that the witness has identified the defendant.
Direct exam continues.
Cross exam by Atty Kryshak.
Witness is excused.

Court states findings.

BY THE COURT: 
Court finds it is probable that a crime was committed and this defendant committed it and binds the defendant over for trial. 

Atty Kryshak states that information was received and waives its reading.
Atty Kryshak enters a NOT GUILTY PLEA on behalf of the defendant.

BY THE COURT:
NOT GUILTY plea entered.
Matter set for pre-trial on 10-31-2022 at 10 AM.

IN 22CF300: (correction 22CF351-ss)
Officer Koback is sworn in by the clerk.
Direct exam by ADA Dodge.
Court questions the witness.
Direct exam continues.
Atty Kryshak stipulates that the witness has identified the defendant.
Cross exam by Atty Kryshak.
Witness is excused.

ADA Dodge provides closing argument.
Atty Kryshak provides closing argument and moves to dismiss.

Court states findings.

BY THE COURT: 
Motion to dismiss is granted. (for case 22CF351-ss)
Pre-trial conference scheduled for October 31, 2022 at 10:00 am.

3:30 PM Defendant Lorenzo M Miner in court, in custody.  Attorney (Atty) Gary J. Kryshak in court for Lorenzo M Miner.  Attorney (Atty) Jedidiah J Dodge in court for State of Wisconsin.  Cases 22CF300 and 22CF351.  Judge recuses himself and parties move over to branch 3 to be heard today.

ADDRESS INFO for Lorenzo M Miner
Current: 1402 Royalton St, c/o Waupaca County Jail, Waupaca, WI 54981 United States  (Effective: 08-02-2022)
Prior: 627 Minnesota Ave, Stevens Point, WI 54481

No contact with the victim, J.J.H
No contact with co-defendants, L.S and L.T.
Do not possess any firearms or other dangerous weapons.

2:32 PM Defendant Lorenzo M Miner appeared by video, in custody at the Waupaca County Jail.   Attorney Gary J. Kryshak in court for Lorenzo M Miner.  Attorney Andrew Mutchler in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Cases heard today are 22CF300 & 22CF351.

Attorney/Defendant received a copy of the criminal complaint on both cases.
Court informs defendant of the charges and maximum penalties.
Attorney/Defendant waives reading of the complaint.
Attorney waives time limits for the preliminary hearing to be held on 22CF300  and 22CF351.

Court advises defendant of right to counsel/public defender representation.

State recommends a $10,000 signature bond with conditions as stated on 22CF351.
Atty Kryshak would request a cash bond for his client.
Court orders a $10,000 signature bond with conditions as stated on the record.
BY THE COURT:  Bond continued in 22CF300.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for September 19, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
Preliminary hearing on September 19, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
Initial Appearance set for August 1, 2022 @ 2:30 p.m. in Br 3
Initial Appearance set for August 8, 2022 @ 1:45 p.m. in Br 1
